question_text: Will there be a new world record in the 2025 World Figure Skating Championships?
resolution_criteria:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if in the 2025 World Figure Skating Championships, there is a new world record in any category (men's singles, women's singles, pairs, ice dance), for any segment, on any of the possible scores:

* TES – Technical element score
* PCS – Program component score
* TSS – Total segment score
* Combine Total TSS across segments.
fine_print:
* If at least half of the 2025 World Figure Skating Championships events do not take place before April 7, 2025, this question will be **annulled**.
* In case a performance setting a new record is announced, but has not been officially verified (in case of potential disputes), it will count for the purposes of this question if it has not been cancelled as of April 7, 2025.
* The [current world records](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_highest_scores_in_figure_skating) are presented below:

| Category        | Segment        | Score type | Score  |
| --------------- | -------------- | ---------- | ------ |
| Men's singles   | Combined total | TSS        | 335.30 |
| Men's singles   | Short program  | TSS        | 113.97 |
| Men's singles   | Short program  | TES        | 65.98  |
| Men's singles   | Short program  | PCS        | 48.47  |
| Men's singles   | Free skating   | TSS        | 227.79 |
| Men's singles   | Free skating   | TES        | 137.18 |
| Men's singles   | Free skating   | PCS        | 97.22  |
| Women's singles | Combined total | TSS        | 272.71 |
| Women's singles | Short program  | TSS        | 87.52  |
| Women's singles | Short program  | TES        | 49.97  |
| Women's singles | Short program  | PCS        | 37.56  |
| Women's singles | Free skating   | TSS        | 185.29 |
| Women's singles | Free skating   | TES        | 109.02 |
| Women's singles | Free skating   | PCS        | 76.27  |
| Pairs           | Combined total | TSS        | 239.88 |
| Pairs           | Short program  | TSS        | 84.41  |
| Pairs           | Short program  | TES        | 46.04  |
| Pairs           | Short program  | PCS        | 38.45  |
| Pairs           | Free skating   | TSS        | 157.46 |
| Pairs           | Free skating   | TES        | 81.45  |
| Pairs           | Free skating   | PCS        | 76.99  |
| Ice dance       | Combined total | TSS        | 232.32 |
| Ice dance       | Rhythm dance   | TSS        | 93.91  |
| Ice dance       | Rhythm dance   | TES        | 55.16  |
| Ice dance       | Rhythm dance   | PCS        | 39.57  |
| Ice dance       | Free dance     | TSS        | 138.41 |
| Ice dance       | Free dance     | TES        | 79.41  |
| Ice dance       | Free dance     | PCS        | 59.70  |

‎
background_info:
[Figure skating](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Figure_skating) is a winter sport in which individuals, pairs, or groups perform on ice while incorporating jumps, spins, lifts, and footwork into choreographed routines set to music. The [World Figure Skating Championships](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2025_World_Figure_Skating_Championships), organised annually by the [International Skating Union](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/International_Skating_Union) (ISU) since 1896, represents the most prestigious annual competition in the sport outside the Olympic Games. The [2025 World Championships](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2025_World_Figure_Skating_Championships) are scheduled to take place in Boston, from March 25 to March 30.

In all official competitions, athletes are scored using the [ISU Judging System](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISU_Judging_System), which consists of two components: the Technical Score (TES) and the Program Components Score (PCS). The Technical Score assesses the difficulty and execution of specific elements (jumps, spins, and step sequences) with each element receiving a base value [ranging](https://www.usfigureskating.org/sites/default/files/media-files/ISU%202656%20ISU_SOV_SinglesPairs_2024-25_final.pdf) from 0.40 to 14, which is then adjusted using a -5 to +5 grade based on the athlete's execution. The Program Components Score evaluates five aspects of the performance: skating skills, transitions, performance, composition, and interpretation of music, with judges awarding points on a scale of 0.25 to 10.00 in each category.

The TES and PCS are added together to form the Total Segment Score (TSS), which is calculated for both short programs and free skating and added together to determine an athlete's final ranking.

question_text: Will Volodymyr Zelenskyy meet with Donald Trump again before April 7, 2025?
resolution_criteria: This question will resolve as **Yes** if Volodymyr Zelenskyy meets with Donald Trump after March 3 and before April 7, 2025.
fine_print:
* The meeting has to be in person. 
* The overall duration of the meeting does not matter, as long as Trump and Zelenskyy speak directly to each other for at least one minute, continuously.
background_info:
Relations between Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy and US President Donald Trump broke down after a [tense Oval Office meeting](https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/articles/c2erwgwy8vgo) on February 28 ([video](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=W6qFzWaaZ_o)). The discussion was meant to seal a deal granting the US access to Ukraine's rare earth minerals in exchange for continued support against Russia. Instead, Trump criticised Zelenskyy for lacking gratitude for US aid and questioned his approach to the war, while Zelenskyy insisted on security guarantees from the US and emphasised Russia's role as the aggressor in the war.

The unresolved meeting left US support for Ukraine uncertain, with Zelenskyy not signing the deal before departing from the White House. Various European leaders voiced support for Ukraine, Keir Starmer [insisted](https://www.politico.eu/article/europe-leaders-pledge-increase-defense-spending-nato-mark-rutte-keir-starmer-london-summit/) that any peace plan must have US' backing. A few days after leaving the Oval Office, [Zelenskyy said](https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/articles/c8j0ggm3mdwo) that he would still be willing to sign a deal on rare earth minerals.

During his 2024 campaign, Trump [promised](https://www.nytimes.com/2025/01/19/us/politics/trump-promise-ending-ukraine-war.html) to end the Russia-Ukraine war early in his presidency, often suggesting he could broker peace through direct talks with Moscow, a stance he framed as pragmatic and cost-saving for the US.

question_text: What will the total number of Tesla vehicle deliveries be for Q1 2025?
resolution_criteria: This question will resolve as the total number of Tesla vehicle deliveries for the first quarter of 2025, [according to Tesla](https://ir.tesla.com/press). For example, [for Q4 2024](https://ir.tesla.com/press-release/tesla-fourth-quarter-2024-production-deliveries-and-deployments) the equivalent number would be 495,570.
fine_print: * If the delivery figures for Q1 2025 are not published by Tesla before April 7, 2025, this question will be **annulled**.
background_info:
[Tesla](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Tesla,_Inc.), the [second largest](https://www.fool.com/research/largest-ev-companies/) electric vehicle (EV) company in the world, has seen [significant sales growth](https://www.statista.com/statistics/502208/tesla-quarterly-vehicle-deliveries/) in recent years. However, Tesla reported its [first decline in annual vehicle deliveries](https://www.cnbc.com/2025/01/02/tesla-tsla-q4-2024-vehicle-delivery-and-production-numbers.html) in 2024. Despite the annual decline during 2024, the fourth quarter of 2024 saw its largest number of deliveries, [reporting](https://ir.tesla.com/press-release/tesla-fourth-quarter-2024-production-deliveries-and-deployments) 495,570 cars delivered.

However, some analysts [think](https://x.com/TroyTeslike/status/1894654134730530882) that Tesla CEO [Elon Musk](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Elon_Musk)'s recent political involvement with President Donald Trump and the [Department of Government Efficiency](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Department_of_Government_Efficiency) (DOGE) may harm Tesla's delivery prospects. [Reports](https://www.teslarati.com/tesla-stores-vehicles-chargers-vandalism-protests/#google_vignette) of protests against Tesla and Tesla vehicles being vandalized and defaced have gone viral on social media.

Tesla [typically reports](https://ir.tesla.com/press) quarterly deliveries ahead of its full earnings, usually on the second day of the following quarter.

question_text: How many cases will be confirmed in the Texas measles outbreak before April 7, 2025?
resolution_criteria: This question will resolve as the number of measles cases reported by the [Texas Department of Health and Human Services](https://www.dshs.texas.gov/news-alerts/measles-outbreak-feb-28-2025) as of April 6, 2025.
fine_print: This will resolve based on the latest announcement or update by DSHS Texas, if that announcement has been published after March 31, 2025. If no such update has been published, this question might resolve based on a CDC announcement, provided that has been published after March 31, 2025. Otherwise, this question will be **annulled**.
background_info: As of February 28, 2025, Texas is experiencing its largest measles outbreak [since 1992](https://www.reuters.com/business/healthcare-pharmaceuticals/measles-death-texas-puts-kennedys-vaccine-views-test-2025-02-27/), with a total of [146 cases](https://www.dshs.texas.gov/news-alerts/measles-outbreak-feb-28-2025) confirmed. 20 patients have been hospitalised and one has died, being the first measles death in the US since 2015. The outbreak [started](https://www.usatoday.com/story/news/health/2025/02/25/texas-measles-outbreak-spread-rural-america/79624727007/) in a Mennonite community in Gaines County, which has among the [lowest vaccination rates](https://cbsaustin.com/news/local/texas-leaders-quiet-amid-the-biggest-measles-outbreak-in-decades-gaines-county-republicans-democrats-children-lubbock-community-pandemic-vaccines) in the country, but has already [crossed state lines](https://www.houstonchronicle.com/health/article/hotez-texas-measles-outbreak-20190069.php) into New Mexico.

question_text: When will the DC cherry trees reach peak bloom in 2025?
resolution_criteria: This question will resolve as the 2025 Peak Bloom date, according to the [National Park Service](https://www.nps.gov/subjects/cherryblossom/bloom-watch.htm).
fine_print: If the peak bloom has not taken place until April 7, 2025, this question will resolve as **April 1 or later**. If credible sources point to the peak bloom having taken place, but NPS does not officially announce a date, this question will resolve as **Ambiguous**.
background_info:
[In 1912](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/National_Cherry_Blossom_Festival#Early_initiatives), the mayor of Tokyo sent 3,020 cherry trees as a symbol of friendship between Japan and the United States. The trees were largely planted around the Tidal Basin near the Jefferson Memorial. Over time, some of the original trees have died, but have been replaced or propagated, to reach a total of about [3,800 trees](https://www.nps.gov/subjects/cherryblossom/types-of-trees.htm) as of 2025.

Every year since 1927, the National Cherry Blossom Festival commemorates this gift with a celebration that has grown from a simple ceremony into a major cultural event drawing visitors from around the world to watch the cherries bloom, signalling the arrival of spring.

The timing of the bloom varies each year, depending on weather conditions, and is carefully tracked by the National Park Service (NPS). Peak bloom is [defined](https://www.nps.gov/subjects/cherryblossom/bloom-watch.htm) as the day when 70% of the [Yoshino cherry](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Prunus_%C3%97_yedoensis) blossoms are open - the Yoshino variety being the most common in the Tidal Basin. It usually happens in the last week of March or the first week of April, but extreme temperatures have resulted in peaks as early as March 15 (1990) and as late as April 18 (1958).

As of the beginning of March, peak bloom is forecasted to take place between March 28 and 31. Data for past blooms can be found [here](https://www.nps.gov/subjects/cherryblossom/bloom-watch.htm).

question_text: Will 900,000 Russian personnel losses be reported before March 21, 2025?
resolution_criteria:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if, before March 21, 2025, the General Staff of the Armed Forces of Ukraine reports 900,000 or more total Russian personnel losses on their [official site](https://mod.gov.ua/en/news?tags=Combat) or public media pages ([Facebook](https://www.facebook.com/GeneralStaff.ua), [Telegram](https://t.me/GeneralStaffZSU), [X.com](https://x.com/GeneralStaffUA)).

If all reports published before March 21, 2025 show numbers below 900,000, this question resolves as **No**. This includes the case when the General Staff of the AFU stops publishing their data due to a ceasefire or peace agreement.
fine_print:
* "Personnel losses" in this context are *killed and wounded* soldiers and that wounded soldiers may return to the battlefield later.
* In the past there was at least one occasion on [May 27, 2023](https://www.facebook.com/GeneralStaff.ua/posts/594141432898939?ref=embed_post) when the error in the previous day's report was admitted and corrected. For this reason, the question will resolve two days later than any published report, although it will retroactively close before the date the report was first published.
* Historical trackers mentioned in the Background information ([russian-casualties-in-ua](https://russian-casualties.in.ua/), [Combat.FYI](https://combat.fyi/) and the [2022-Ukraine-Russia-War-Dataset](https://github.com/PetroIvaniuk/2022-Ukraine-Russia-War-Dataset/blob/main/data/russia_losses_personnel.json)) may be used as secondary resolution sources if the main resolution pages are banned/unavailable.
background_info:
Since the beginning of the Russian invasion in 2022, the General Staff of the Armed Forces of Ukraine releases their daily estimation of Russian losses in personnel, vehicles, aircraft, and other military equipment on their pages in social networks (see links in Resolution Criteria).

On February 19, 2025, they [reported](https://mod.gov.ua/en/news/the-estimated-combat-losses-of-russians-over-the-last-day-1-300-persons-175-ua-vs-and-72-artillery-systems) a total of 862,390 estimated casualties. At the same time the daily rate is being constantly above 1000 since July 25, 2024. With the pace of 1300 casualties per day the number of 900,000 casualties should be reached on March 20, 2025.

Historical data can be tracked by independent trackers
such as [russian-casualties-in-ua](https://russian-casualties.in.ua/) , [Combat.FYI](https://combat.fyi/) and in the [2022-Ukraine-Russia-War-Dataset](https://github.com/PetroIvaniuk/2022-Ukraine-Russia-War-Dataset/blob/main/data/russia_losses_personnel.json).

question_text: Will Argentina's Chamber of Deputies impeach President Javier Milei before April 1, 2025?
resolution_criteria: This question will resolve as **Yes** if, before April 1, 2025, the Chamber of Deputies approves one or more articles of impeachment against Javier Milei with the constitutionally required two-thirds majority vote, according to [credible sources](https://www.metaculus.com/faq/#definitions).
fine_print:
The outcome of the trial in the Senate is immaterial for the purposes of this question.

Please note that the English words *impeach, impeached* or *impeachment* are used for the Spanish word *el acusado* or *los acusados* as used in Article 59 of Argentina's constitution ([Spanish version](https://www.congreso.gob.ar/constitucionSeccion1Cap2.php), [English version](https://www.congreso.gob.ar/constitucionSeccion1Cap2_ingles.php))
background_info:
On 14 February 2025, the Panamanian company KIP Protocol created the [\$LIBRA](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/%24Libra) token, as part of a project called [*Viva La Libertad*](https://www.vivalalibertadproject.com/es-ar). The token launch was not publicised by the company, but a few minutes after its creation Argentina's President [Javier Milei](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Javier_Milei "Javier Milei") published on his official Instagram, Twitter and Facebook accounts, promoting it.

![](https://metaculus-web-media.s3.amazonaws.com/user_uploaded/0h9ZcPTAhdLnYSEVW.jpg.webp)

\[Translation:

Liberal Argentina is growing!!!
This private project will be dedicated to promoting the growth of the Argentine economy by funding small businesses and Argentine entrepreneurs.
The world wants to invest in Argentina.

vivalalibertadproject.com

Contract: Bo9jh3wsmcC2AjakLWzNmKJ3SgtZmXEcSaW7L2FAvUsU

\$LIBRA

LONG LIVE FREEDOM, DAMN IT...!!!]

The value of the token surged to \$5.20 and plummeted shortly thereafter, the price plummeted, resulting in approximately \$87 million in losses for around 74,000 investors.

Milei then posted [the following tweet](https://x.com/JMilei/status/1890606683291779195) (translated):

> A few hours ago I posted a tweet, as I have so many other times, supporting a supposed private enterprise with which I obviously have no connection whatsoever.
> ‎
> I was not aware of the details of the project and after having become aware of it I decided not to continue spreading the word (that is why I deleted the tweet).
> ‎
> To the filthy rats of the political caste who want to take advantage of this situation to do harm, I want to say that every day they confirm how vile politicians are, and they increase our conviction to kick them in the ass.
> ‎
> VLLC!

A timeline of the events can be found [here](https://cenital.com/el-minuto-a-minuto-del-memecoin-que-promociono-milei/) (in Spanish).

Opposition members have accused Milei of a rug pull and [have claimed](https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/articles/cp9x9j89evxo) that they will initiate impeachment proceedings. In Argentina, the [Chamber of Deputies](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Argentine_Chamber_of_Deputies) (lower house) has the sole power to initiate impeachment proceedings and must approve articles of impeachment by a two-thirds majority vote.

question_text: What will be the IMDb rating of Severance's second season finale?
resolution_criteria: This question will resolve as the IMDb rating of [episode 10 of season 2 of Severance](https://www.imdb.com/title/tt15242998) when accessed by Metaculus on or after March 27, 2025.
background_info:
[*Severance*](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Severance_\(TV_series\)#Reception) is a critically acclaimed psychological thriller series on Apple TV+, created by Dan Erickson and directed by Ben Stiller. The show explores a dystopian scenario where employees of Lumon Industries undergo a procedure that separates their work memories from personal ones, raising profound questions about identity and corporate control.

Since its debut in February 2022, *Severance* has garnered widespread praise for its innovative storytelling, direction, and performances, particularly Adam Scott's portrayal of Mark Scout. The series has received [multiple nominations and awards](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Severance_\(TV_series\)#Reception), including 14 Emmy nominations and 3 Golden Globe nominations. 

The second season premiered on January 17, 2025, after a nearly three-year hiatus due to production delays and industry strikes. This season comprises 10 episodes, with new episodes releasing weekly on Apple TV+ until the finale on March 21, 2025. Early reviews suggest that Season 2 [maintains](https://editorial.rottentomatoes.com/article/severance-season-2-first-reviews-deeper-weirder-and-absolutely-worth-the-wait/) the high standards set by its predecessor:

> Critics say the second season is packed with tension, powered by outstanding performances, gorgeous to look at, and thoughtfully written. And it's almost guaranteed to be one of the best shows of 2025.

As of the time of the question writing, the first season has an average rating of 8.33 and the finale a rating of 9.7. The second season's first five episodes have an average of 8.54.

question_text: Will bitcoin trade below $90k for a whole day before April 5, 2025?
resolution_criteria: This question will resolve as **Yes** if bitcoin's daily high falls below \$90,000 on any day after February 23, 2025 and before April 5, 2025, according to CoinMarketCap's [historical data](https://coinmarketcap.com/currencies/bitcoin/historical-data/).
fine_print: If CoinMarketCap does not report these data before April 7, 2025, Metaculus might use the daily high of an alternative credible source to resolve this question.
background_info: Bitcoin rose significantly after the 2024 US presidential elections, from \$65k to more than \$100k, in anticipation of favorable cryptocurrency policies under Donald Trump. The inauguration in January 2025 saw Bitcoin reaching an all-time high of \$109,114.88. However, recent economic data indicating higher-than-expected inflation has [reignited concerns](https://www.investopedia.com/bitcoin-briefly-drops-below-usd95-000-as-inflation-fears-reignite-11678511) about prolonged elevated interest rates, leading to BTC temporarily dropping to \$95k. Still, [certain investors](https://www.marketwatch.com/story/anthony-scaramucci-was-a-hot-wall-street-manager-last-year-thanks-to-crypto-now-he-sees-bitcoin-hitting-200-000-this-year-d3909a39?utm_source=chatgpt.com) expect that bitcoin will continue its overall trend and will hit \$200k during 2025.

question_text: What will be the rank of Assassin's Creed Shadows on Steam's Weekly Top Sellers chart for March 18 - 25, 2025?
resolution_criteria: This question will resolve as Assassin's Creed Shadows' rank in Steam's Global [Weekly Top Sellers](https://store.steampowered.com/charts/topsellers/global/2025-3-18) chart for the week of March 18, 2025 - March 25, 2025, when accessed by Metaculus on or after March 26, 2025.
fine_print: If the chart has not been published until April 1, 2025, this question will be **annulled**.
background_info:
[Assassin's Creed Shadows](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Assassin%27s_Creed_Shadows) is an upcoming action role-playing game developed by Ubisoft Quebec, set to release on March 20, 2025, for PlayStation 5, Windows, Xbox Series X/S, macOS, and iPadOS. The game is set in late 16th-century Japan during the [Azuchi-Momoyama period](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Azuchi%E2%80%93Momoyama_period), a time marked by significant civil unrest and the influence of Portuguese traders and Jesuit missionaries.

[Early impressions](https://www.theguardian.com/culture/2025/jan/23/can-assassins-creed-shadows-save-ubisoft) highlight the game's detailed recreation of feudal Japan, with richly designed environments and a blend of stealth and action gameplay. Given Ubisoft's recent challenges with underperforming titles, the success of Assassin's Creed Shadows [is crucial for the company's future](https://www.polygon.com/impressions/512277/assassins-creed-shadows-preview-ubisoft).

question_text: Will the Trump administration impose new tariffs on the EU before April 7, 2025?
resolution_criteria: This question will resolve as **Yes** if any new US tariffs that apply to imports from all EU member states take effect and stay in effect for at least seven days before April 7, 2025, according to official [White House](https://www.whitehouse.gov/news/) or EU press releases, or other [credible sources](https://www.metaculus.com/faq/#definitions).
fine_print:
* Any tariff that was not in effect on February 14, 2025 counts.
* The whole EU has to be targeted by tariffs. If at least one EU member state is not included, this question will *not* resolve as **Yes**. The tariffs can target other states besides EU members.
* The tariff rate or tariff scope (i.e. which industries are being targetted) is immaterial to the question resolution. If tariffs are postponed after they took effect or canceled after being in effect (even for a short time), the question will still resolve positively.
* The tariffs have to be in effect for a total of seven days. If they come into effect, are paused, and then resume, the total number of days will be used to resolve this question.
background_info:
The new US administration under President Donald J. Trump is aggressively using new tariffs to achieve its policy goals. In the first month of his presidency, the Trump administration [imposed](https://www.whitehouse.gov/fact-sheets/2025/02/fact-sheet-president-donald-j-trump-imposes-tariffs-on-imports-from-canada-mexico-and-china/) a 25% tariff on imports from Canada and Mexico, which were both [postponed](https://www.bbc.com/news/articles/c87d5rlee52o) after agreeing upon new border security measures. An additional [10% tariff](https://www.whitehouse.gov/fact-sheets/2025/02/fact-sheet-president-donald-j-trump-imposes-tariffs-on-imports-from-canada-mexico-and-china/) was also introduced on imports from China.

Trump has already [threatened](https://www.bbc.com/news/articles/cn4zgx808g7o) the EU with tariffs at the beginning of February 2025, mostly because of the fact that currently, the EU imposes a [10% tariff](https://www.reuters.com/business/autos-transportation/bmw-ceo-proposes-cutting-eu-tariff-us-vehicle-imports-25-2025-01-28/) on US cars imported to the bloc, while the US imposes a 2.5% tariff on the EU automotive industry, making US carmakers less competitive in the European markets. The EU also maintains [higher tariffs](https://www.wilsoncenter.org/article/transatlantic-trade-tensions-looming-us-eu-showdown) than the US on some agricultural products, such as beef and pork.

In 2018, the US [imposed](https://policy.trade.ec.europa.eu/eu-trade-relationships-country-and-region/countries-and-regions/united-states_en) tariffs of 25% on steel and 10% on aluminum imports from the EU under Section 232 of the [Trade Expansion Act](https://www.govinfo.gov/content/pkg/STATUTE-76/pdf/STATUTE-76-Pg872.pdf), citing national security concerns. These tariffs [were lifted](https://www.piie.com/blogs/trade-and-investment-policy-watch/2021/biden-and-europe-remove-trumps-steel-and-aluminum) under the Biden administration, but on February 12 they [were reannounced](https://www.reuters.com/markets/eu-should-negotiate-avert-trade-war-germany-says-bloc-ministers-meet-2025-02-12/) by the Trump administration to be imposed from March 12, 2025.

question_text: Who will win the UFC light heavyweight championship at UFC 313?
resolution_criteria: Resolves as the winner of the fight according to [Tapology](https://www.tapology.com/fightcenter/events/120488-ufc-313) or another [credible source](https://www.metaculus.com/faq/#definitions).
fine_print: If the fight does not take place, the question will be **Annulled**.
background_info:
[UFC 313](https://www.tapology.com/fightcenter/events/120488-ufc-313) is an upcoming mix martial arts event, to be held March 8, 2025 in Las Vegas. It is currently expected to feature 10 bouts. The headline fight is between [Alex Pereira](https://www.tapology.com/fightcenter/fighters/117305-alex-pereira) and [Magmed Ankalaev](https://www.tapology.com/fightcenter/fighters/83405-magomed-ankalaev) for the light heavyweight belt, and will consist of 5 rounds of 5 minutes each.

Pereira, from Brazil, has been champion of this weight class since beating Jiří Procházka in November 2023. Pereira's win-loss record is 12-2, and he has won "Performance of the Night" six times, including for each of his last two fights. His background is kickboxing.

Ankalaev is from Dagestan, Russia, and his record is 20-1 (and 1 no contest). His only loss was in 2018. He has won "Performance of the Night" four times.

Under UFC rules, a fight can be won in any of three ways: by submission, by KO/TKO, or by decision. A fight can also end without victory or loss, such as by draw or in no contest. The latter occurs if accident or foul ends the fight before the halfway mark.

question_text: What will the highest rank of metac-GPT4o or metac-o1 be in the Q1 2025 Quarterly Cup?
resolution_criteria: This question will resolve as the rank of [metac-GPT4o](https://www.metaculus.com/accounts/profile/236038/) or [metac-o1](https://www.metaculus.com/accounts/profile/236037/), whichever is higher, in the Q1 2025 Quarterly Cup Leaderboard after all questions besides this one and the [total number of forecasters one](https://www.metaculus.com/questions/34483/total-number-of-forecacsters-in-q1-2025-quarterly-cup/) have been resolved and no more questions are set to open.
fine_print: The bots might disappear from the tournament leaderboard after a question has resolved. Please tag me (@skmmcj) somewhere to make them appear again.
background_info:
Each quarter, Metaculus runs a short tournament called [the Quarterly Cup](https://www.metaculus.com/tournament/32630/), which consists of 40-50 questions on various topics. Quarterly Cups have been some of the most popular tournaments on the site with hundreds of users forecasting on at least one tournament question in each quarter. In Q3 2024, Metaculus launched the [AI Forecasting Benchmark Tournament series](https://www.metaculus.com/notebooks/25525/openai-anthropic-donate-credits-for-ai-forecasting-benchmark-tournament-asknews-provides-free-news-source/), which compares bots on forecasting questions. Bots are also allowed to forecast in other questions too (although they are not included in the Community Prediction) and currently Metaculus has two bots compete in the Quarterly Cup: [metac-GPT4o](https://www.metaculus.com/accounts/profile/236038/) and [metac-o1](https://www.metaculus.com/accounts/profile/236037/).

Both bots consist of a combination of a GPT model and AskNews for search. Both forecast every two days, using the same basic prompt (example for binary questions):

> You are a professional forecaster interviewing for a job.Your interview question is:
> \{title}
> ‎
> Question background:
> \{background}
> ‎
> This question's outcome will be determined by the specific criteria below. These criteria have not yet been satisfied:
> \{resolution\_criteria}
> \{fine\_print}
> ‎
> Your research assistant says:
> \{summary\_report}
> ‎
> Today is
> \{today}.
> ‎
> Before answering you write:
> (a) The time left until the outcome to the question is known.
> (b) The status quo outcome if nothing changed.
> (c) A brief description of a scenario that results in a No outcome.
> (d) A brief description of a scenario that results in a Yes outcome.
> ‎
> You write your rationale remembering that good forecasters put extra weight on the status quo outcome since the world changes slowly most of the time.
> ‎
> The last thing you write is your final answer as: "Probability: ZZ%", 0-100

with the prompt for AskNews being

> You are an assistant to a superforecaster. The superforecaster will give you a question they intend to forecast on. To be a great assistant, you generate a concise but detailed rundown of the most relevant news, including if the question would resolve Yes or No based on current information. You do not produce forecasts yourself.
>  
> Note that bots do not affect forecaster ranks or scores in any way.

question_text: Will China launch an antitrust investigation into Intel before April, 2025?
resolution_criteria: This question will resolve as **Yes** if, before April 1, 2025, China officially launches an antitrust investigation against Intel, according to credible sources.
fine_print: The investigation has to be officially announced, for example via a State Administration for Market Regulation press release.
background_info:
Donald Trump recently imposed a 10% tariff on Chinese imports and eliminated the duty-free exemption for low-value packages, in accordance with his campaing promises. In response, China [filed a complain](https://www.reuters.com/world/china-challenges-trump-tariffs-wto-package-shippers-warn-chaos-2025-02-06/)t with the World Trade Organization, asserting that these U.S. actions are protectionist and violate WTO rules. [Furthermore](https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/articles/czj31l4p7vzo), China impemented various retaliatory measures, including

* its own tariffs on American coal, LGN, agricultural machinery, and pick-up trucks
* adding Calvin Klein to their "unreliable entity" list, accusing them of "discriminatory measures against Chinese enterprises"
* export controls on rare metals
* reviving antitrust investigations against Google and Nvidia.

According to the [Financial Times](https://www.ft.com/content/2ec45e79-9502-4ffd-82e8-888d9283c776), China regulators are also considering launching an investigation against Intel.

question_text: Will the US officially announce the withdrawal of at least half of its troops out of Syria before April, 2025?
resolution_criteria:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if, before April 1, 2025, either of the following has happened:

* the US has officially announced that a plan to withdraw at least half of the US troops stationed in Syria will be set in motion
* such a withdrawal has already taken place, according to [credible sources](https://www.metaculus.com/faq/#definitions).
fine_print:
* The "at least half" part of the resolution criteria could be resolved in various ways, including but not limited to an announcement that at least 1,000 troops will be withdrawn or a maximum of 1,000 troops will remain stationed there, or an announcement that all temporary rotation forces will be withdrawn.
* For this question to resolve as **Yes** via an announcement, it will have to be an official announcement (e.g., via a DoD press briefing, an Executive Order, or CENTCOM official communications) and it will have to imply that a specific plan has been created and the decision to implement it has been made. Vague announcements of intent will not suffice.
* For purposes of this question, the number of US troops in Syria is assumed to be 2,000. In cases in which the denominator is announced to be different from 2,000, the one-half threshold will be adjusted accordingly.
background_info: According to [NBC](https://www.nbcnews.com/politics/national-security/dod-drafting-plans-withdraw-us-troops-syria-recent-trump-comments-rcna190726), the US Department of Defense is drafting plans for a full withdrawal of American troops from Syria following renewed interest from Donald Trump. The proposed withdrawal could occur within 30, 60, or 90 days, though officials emphasise that no final decision has been made. Trump had briefly removed US forces from Syria in the past, however he quickly reinstated them and as of early 2025, approximately 2,000 personnel are stationed there (1,100 troops as "temporary rotational forces" and 900 as "core troops"). The US military mission in Syria has been to counter ISIS and support local military groups, such as the Kurdish-led Syrian Democratic Forces (SDF). A withdrawal could jeopardize these efforts, particularly regarding the security of detention facilities housing thousands of ISIS fighters.

question_text: How many earthquakes of magnitude ≥ 4 will happen near Santorini, Greece in the first week of March, 2025?
resolution_criteria: This question will resolve as the number of earthquakes with a magnitude (Mag.) of at least 4.0 and an Epicentral Location near Santorini (Thira) in the time period of March 1 to March 7, 2025, inclusive, as reported by [the Department of Geophysics-Geothermics](http://www.geophysics.geol.uoa.gr/stations/maps/recent_eq_10d.htm) of the University of Athens.
fine_print:
* The "Origin Time (GMT)" column of the resolution source will be used to determine which earthquakes have happened in the first week of March.
* For the purposes of this question, "near Santorini" is defined as having an Epicentral Location mentioning "Thira" in any way.
* If the resolution source does not report the data until April 6, 2025, this question will be **annulled**.
background_info:
On February 6, 2025, the Greek government [declared](https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/articles/ce8jlm6rm9qo) a state of emergency in the island of Santorini following an unprecedented surge in seismic activity. Over 11,000 residents and workers have evacuated amid fears of a significant earthquake. The seismic wave has produced thousands of tremors, including 94 earthquakes of a magnitude of 4 or higher in the first six days of February, with the strongest one reaching a magnitude of 5.1 on February 5. Authorities have closed schools, restricted access to high-risk areas, and mobilised emergency services, including specialized firefighters, police, coast guard, and military units, to assist with evacuations and maintain order.

Despite the island being an [active volcano](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Santorini_caldera) (part of the [South Aegean Volcanic Arc](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/South_Aegean_Volcanic_Arc)), it has seen no major eruptions since 1950 and experts estimate that the current seismic activity is tectonic rather than volcanic in origin. It is unclear how long the activity will last, with local authorities [warning](https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/articles/cp8qpn2p795o) that it could be weeks. The state of emergency is set to end on March 3, 2025.

question_text: How many executive orders will Donald Trump sign in February and March 2025?
resolution_criteria:
This question will resolve as the number of Executive Orders signed by Donald J. Trump in February and March 2025, according to [the Federal Register](https://www.federalregister.gov/presidential-documents/executive-orders).

##### Note that this question closes early, on March 10, 2025.
fine_print:
* An Executive Order is any presidential document with an Executive Order number. Orders that do not have such a number will not count for this question.
* If the Federal Register delays in publishing an Executive Order, Metaculus might use alternative credible sources to resolve this question, such as [the Presidential Actions archive](https://www.whitehouse.gov/presidential-actions/).
* This question will resolve according to the number of Executive Orders signed by Donald Trump in February and March, 2025. The date of publication is immaterial for this question.
background_info:
According to [Wikipedia](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Executive_order):

> In the United States, an executive order is a directive by the president of the United States that manages operations of the federal government. The legal or constitutional basis for executive orders has multiple sources. Article Two of the United States Constitution gives presidents broad executive and enforcement authority to use their discretion to determine how to enforce the law or to otherwise manage the resources and staff of the executive branch. The ability to make such orders is also based on expressed or implied Acts of Congress that delegate to the president some degree of discretionary power (delegated legislation).

The number of Executive Orders that presidents issue in their first months in office has been rising significantly over the past years:

| President      | Period  | Number of EOs |
| -------------- | ------- | ------------- |
| Bill Clinton   | Q1 1993 | 9             |
| George W. Bush | Q1 2021 | 8             |
| Barack Obama   | Q1 2009 | 18            |
| Donald Trump   | Q1 2017 | 23            |
| Joe Biden      | Q1 2021 | 37            |

Trump surpassed all previous records in the first 8 days in office, [having signed](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_executive_orders_in_the_second_presidency_of_Donald_Trump) 58 executive orders as of February 6, 2025.

question_text: What will the total number of tokens launched on the site pump.fun be, as of March 31, 2025?
resolution_criteria:
This question resolves as the value displayed on the [Cumulative Pump Tokens tracker](https://dune.com/queries/3756231/6378326) for March 31, 2025 when accessed by Metaculus on or after April 1, 2025.

##### Note that this question closes early, on March 3, 2025.
fine_print: If no value for March 31, 2025 is shown on the tracker before April 6, 2025, this question will resolve based on any comparable values found on other dashboards on [dune.com](https://dune.com/). If no such alternative dashboards are available, the question will be **annulled**.
background_info:
[pump.fun](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Pump.fun) (commonly referred to as Pump) is a cryptocurrency trading platform for the Solana blockchain that enables users to create tokens and trade them immediately on the platform, as well as to launch them onto decentralized exchanges like Raydium. It has become famous for "rug-pulls" also called "pump and dump" schemes, which are a way the creator of a crypto token "exit-scams" their users, by selling their entire share at once. This was facilitated by the easy token creation process on the site.

The platform has come under scrutiny recently in relation to the livestreaming service it also offered as a way for users to advertise their tokens. It was indefinitely disabled as a result of misuse in extreme ways, such as animal abuse, torture, sexual activities and even [a faked suicide](https://www.dlnews.com/articles/defi/fake-suicide-on-pump-fun-prompted-outrage-and-a-shutdown/ "a faked suicide"). pump.fun has also suspended operations in the UK.

Live and historical data about the site can be found on the [pump.fun dashboard](https://dune.com/adam_tehc/pumpfun) by [adam\_tehc](https://dune.com/adam_tehc).

question_text: What will be the total number of forecasters in the Q1 2025 Quarterly Cup?
resolution_criteria: This question will resolve as the total number of human forecasters that have submitted at least one forecast in any [Q1 2025 Quarterly Cup](https://www.metaculus.com/tournament/32630/) question that has properly resolved besides this one. The number will be found on the bottom of the relevant leaderboard after all questions besides this one have been resolved.
fine_print:
* "Properly resolved" means that the question does not have an **Annulled** or **Ambiguous** resolution.
* The total number of forecasters excludes bots, and Metaculus admins, but not Metaculus moderators.
background_info:
Each quarter, Metaculus runs a short tournament called [the Quarterly Cup](https://www.metaculus.com/tournament/32630/), which consists of 40-50 questions on various topics. Quarterly Cups have been some of the most popular tournaments on the site with hundreds of users forecasting on at least one tournament question in each quarter. In the last quarter of 2024 participation dropped sharply, potentially as a result of users having to navigate the [massive site rewrite](https://www.metaculus.com/notebooks/28734/) that was published in early October.

In early 2025, Metaculus launched the [ACX2025](https://www.metaculus.com/tournament/ACX2025/), the [Brazil Prediction Tournament](https://www.metaculus.com/tournament/Brasil/), and the 2025 [Bridgewater Forecasting Contest](https://www.metaculus.com/tournament/32567/), leading to a record number of users signing up for the site (11,050 from January 27 to February 2, 2025, almost five times the previous weekly record of 2,348 in October 2024!). It is unclear, though, what percentage of these users might forecast on questions outside of these prized tournaments.

The total number of forecasters for past Quarterly Cups can be found below.

| Quarter | Total forecasters |
| ------- | ----------------- |
| Q3 2023 | 842               |
| Q4 2023 | 838               |
| Q1 2024 | 709               |
| Q2 2024 | 1002              |
| Q3 2024 | 760               |
| Q4 2024 | 379               |

question_text: Will DeepSeek be ranked higher than ChatGPT on the AppStore on April 1, 2025?
resolution_criteria:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if the [DeepSeek - AI Assistant app](https://apps.apple.com/gb/app/deepseek-ai-assistant/id6737597349) is ranked higher than [ChatGPT](https://apps.apple.com/gb/app/chatgpt/id6448311069) in the [Top free iPhone Productivity Apps](https://apps.apple.com/gb/charts/iphone/productivity-apps/6007?chart=top-free) list of the AppStore when accessed by Metaculus on April 1, 2025.

#### Note that this question closes early, on March 11, 2025.
fine_print: If ChatGPT is not present in the list but DeepSeek is, this question will resolve as **Yes**. If DeepSeek is not present but ChatGPT is, this question will resolve as **No**. If neither is present, this question will resolve as **Ambiguous**.
background_info:
[DeepSeek](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/DeepSeek) is a Chinese AI company founded in 2023 by Liang Wenfeng. In December 2024, the company released DeepSeek v3, an open source model with 37B active parameters that cost under \$6 million to train. Despite its size or its training cost, v3 had incredible benchmark scores, [significantly outperforming GPT-4o 0513](https://arxiv.org/html/2412.19437v1#S5). DeepSeek followed this up with DeepSeek R1 in January 2025, which [appeared to be](https://github.com/deepseek-ai/DeepSeek-R1/blob/main/DeepSeek_R1.pdf) on par with OpenAI's o1.

By January 27, 2025, DeepSeek's chatbot app had surpassed ChatGPT as the most-downloaded free app on both the App Store and Google Play, leading to Nvidia's stock [dropping](https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/articles/c0qw7z2v1pgo) more than 15%, accompanied by similar but smaller drops in the stock prices of Microsoft and Google.

question_text: Which of the five largest companies in the world will see the highest stock price growth in February and March, 2025?
resolution_criteria:
This question will resolve as the stock with the highest relative growth from January 31, 2025 to March 31, 2025, according to [Yahoo Finance](https://finance.yahoo.com/).

Historical data can be accessed at the following locations:

* [AAPL](https://finance.yahoo.com/quote/AAPL/history/)
* [AMZN](https://finance.yahoo.com/quote/AMZN/history/)
* [GOOG](https://finance.yahoo.com/quote/GOOG/history/)
* [MSFT](https://finance.yahoo.com/quote/MSFT/history/)
* [NVDA](https://finance.yahoo.com/quote/NVDA/history/)
fine_print:
* The ratio of the adjusted closing price on March 31 to the adjusted closing price on January 31 will be used to determine the highest relative growth.
* If Yahoo Finance has not released the relevant data before April 7, 2025, Metaculus might use alternative credible sources to resolve this question.
* If a stock splits, the price will be adjusted for the calculations to reflect the pre-split value if Yahoo Finance does not already make the necessary adjustment.
background_info:
As of January 23, 2025, [the largest companies in the world](https://companiesmarketcap.com/) are all US tech companies:

* NVIDIA, \$3.565T
* Apple, \$3.359T
* Microsoft, \$3.292T
* Amazon, \$2.456T
* Alphabet, \$2.451T

which together total more than 25% of the S\&P 500.

question_text: What will be the difference between the Arena Score of o3 and the next best model on Chatbot Arena, on April 5, 2025?
resolution_criteria:
This question will resolve as the Arena Score for the highest-ranked version of o3 minus the Arena Score for the highest-ranked non-o3 model in the Overall category at the [Chatbot Arena](https://lmarena.ai/) Leaderboard as of April 5, 2025. If no o3 version is scored on Chatbot Arena on April 5, 2025, this question will be **annulled**.

#### Note that this question closes early, on March 15, 2025.
fine_print:
* The Style Control filter will not be used.
* Any o3 version qualifies, including o3-mini, o3-preview or any other model which includes "o3" in its name.
* If the top model on the leaderboard is not an o3 version, this question will resolve as a negative number.
background_info:
[Chatbot Arena](https://lmarena.ai/) (previously hosted on [https://lmsys.org/)](https://lmsys.org/\)) is a [benchmarking platform](https://lmsys.org/blog/2023-05-03-arena/) for large language models (LLMs). It uses an [Elo rating system](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Elo_rating_system) similar to the one used in chess to rank LLMs by their capabilities. Rankings are based on user ratings of different LLM systems. Besides general rankings, Chatbot Arena has added various more narrow categories, such as Hard Prompts, Instruction Following, or Math.

[o3](https://openai.com/index/early-access-for-safety-testing/) is the latest model developed by OpenAI, announced on the "12th day of OpenAI" on December 20, 2024. Is is a successor to [o1](https://openai.com/o1/), a series of models [trained](https://openai.com/index/learning-to-reason-with-llms/) to use chain of thought to solve complex problems. [According to OpenAI](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=SKBG1sqdyIU), o3 performs significantly better in math, coding, and various other benchmarks than all currently released models. o3-mini, a more efficient but potentially less intelligent version of o3, is planned to be released in late January or early February 2025.

question_text: Will TikTok become available in the US on both the App Store and Google Play before April 5, 2025?
resolution_criteria: This question will resolve as **Yes** if at any point after January 25, 2025 and before April 5, 2025, TikTok is available for download in the US from both the App Store and Google Play without the use of VPNs or other technical workarounds.
fine_print: * If the app is simultaneously available for any amount of time from both locations and then becomes unavailable again, this question will still resolve as **Yes**.
background_info:
The United States Congress [passed a law](https://www.cbsnews.com/news/why-is-tiktok-being-banned-supreme-court-congress/) that bans TikTok from the US starting January 20, 2025, but President Trump [issued an executive order](https://apnews.com/article/tiktok-ban-executive-order-trump-0bbae2d2d6f102944f41bb75ad40ce69) delaying the implementation of the ban for 75 days. has claimed that he will overturn the ban. The question is whether or not he will be successful in doing so over the first few months of his presidency.

See also from Forbes: [When Will TikTok Be Back In App Stores? What Could Happen Without Updates](https://www.forbes.com/sites/monicamercuri/2025/01/22/when-will-tiktok-be-back-in-app-stores-what-could-happen-without-updates/)

question_text: How many hostages will Hamas release after January 26 and before April 5, 2025?
resolution_criteria: This question will resolve as the total number of hostages that have been released by Hamas after January 26, 2025 and before April 5, 2025, according to [credible sources](https://www.metaculus.com/faq/#definitions).
fine_print: Hostages have to be alive at the time they are released by Hamas.
background_info: As of January 23, 2025, Israel and Hamas [are observing a ceasefire](https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/articles/cx25g41d8r8o) that began on January 19, 2025, following 15 months of intense conflict. Despite the ceasefire, tensions persist. Israeli forces [have conducted](https://apnews.com/article/israel-hamas-war-syria-lebanon-news-01-23-2025-44893a87c081bf5e59ee8fe66975f250) operations in the West Bank, resulting in casualties among Palestinian militants. Hamas [has reasserted](https://www.reuters.com/world/middle-east/hamas-tight-grip-gaza-complicates-plan-for-lasting-peace-2025-01-22/) control over Gaza, complicating efforts for lasting peace. While the ceasefire has halted large-scale hostilities, the situation remains fragile, with [both sides expressing skepticism](https://www.theguardian.com/world/2025/jan/19/gaza-ceasefire-will-israel-hamas-agreement-hold) about the truce's durability. Hamas has released 3 Israeli hostages and [is planning](https://www.reuters.com/world/middle-east/israeli-hostages-get-heartfelt-tribute-tel-aviv-drag-festival-2025-01-23/) to release some 30 more.

question_text: What Premier League position will Nottingham Forest F.C. be in on March 10, 2025?
resolution_criteria: This question will resolve as the league position of Nottingham Forest, as defined by the [official Premier League site](https://www.premierleague.com/tables), upon completion of Gameweek 28, which is currently scheduled for March 10, 2025.
fine_print:
* The appropriate sub-question will resolve regardless of a game postponement or abandonment.
* Should Nottingham Forest be subject to an external penalty during the 2024/25 season resulting in a point deduction that impacts their league position or in relegation, the question will be **annulled**. If the point deduction does not impact their position, this question will resolve normally.
background_info:
In the late 1970's, under the leadership of the legendary manager Brian Clough, [Nottingham Forest F.C. ](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Nottingham_Forest_F.C.#)("Forest") were title contenders for the [Premier League](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Premier_League) (First Division at the time) - long regarded as the most competitive football (or soccer for those located in the US) league in the world - alongside rivals Liverpool.

> At the end of the 1970s, there were two teams dominating English football: Bob Paisley’s much-lauded Liverpool and an up-and-coming [Nottingham Forest](https://www.theguardian.com/football/nottinghamforest) under the guidance of the inimitable Brian Clough. In the final two seasons of the decade, they were the top two in the old First Division, winning a title each. When the two went face-to-face, it felt as if the victor was guaranteed success.¹ 

Having won the league in the 1978 season, Forest have subsequently been subject to back-and-forth promotions and relegations to the First and Second Divisions, but upon securing recent promotion, Forrest are currently ranked second in the Premier League, and on January 14, 2025, Forrest [drew](https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/live/c62e8m3z0zjt) with Liverpool rivals 1-1 at home, leaving them six points shy of Liverpool, who are currently in first place and favourites to lift the 2024/25 Premier League title, and one point shy of Arsenal in third place.

Not only has Forest's run resurfaced memories of their bitter rivalry with Liverpool in the 1970s - including their status as a top Premier League team - it also has some resemblance² to [Leicester City F.C.'s extraordinary Premier League win in 2016](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Leicester_City_F.C.#Premier_League_champions,_FA_Cup_winners,_relegation_and_promotion_\(2015–present\)) which was given 5,000/1 odds by several prominent UK sports betting companies.

***

¹ Guardian: [Nottingham Forest and Liverpool revive rivalry forged in late 1970s](https://www.theguardian.com/football/2025/jan/14/nottingham-forest-liverpool-rivalry-clough-paisley) 

² [Betfred](https://insights.betfred.com/football/nottingham-forest-premier-league-odds-40-1/): *"1,000/1 to be Premier League champions in September - and 66/1 for a top-six finish."*

***

Nottingham Forrest are due to play a further six times, from Gameweek 24 (completes February 12) to 28 (completes March 8):

1. Nottingham Forest versus Brighton
2. Fulham versus Nottingham Forest
3. Newcastle versus Nottingham Forest
4. Nottingham Forrest versus Arsenal
5. Nottingham Forrest versus Manchester City

question_text: Will the government of Greenland officially announce a date for an independence referendum, before April 6, 2025?
resolution_criteria: This question resolves as **Yes** if, before April 6, 2025, the government of Greenland or any of its agencies officially announce (according to [credible sources](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions)) a specific date on which a referendum on independence from Denmark is scheduled. If no such announcement occurs before April 6, 2025, this question resolves as **No**.

question_text: Who will get the most votes in the first round of the 2025 Ecuadorian presidential election?
resolution_criteria: This question will resolve as the candidate who has received the most votes in the first round of the 2025 Ecuadorian presidential election. If any other outcome occurs other than Daniel Noboa or Luisa González receiving the most votes in first round or if, for any reason, the first round does not happen before April 1, 2025, this question will resolve as **Another outcome.**
fine_print: This question will resolve according to the official outcome announced by a governmental agency with the authority to do so (e.g., the [National Electoral Council](https://www.cne.gob.ec/)). Concerns about the legitimacy of the result from outside sources (e.g., from western media, [election observers](https://www.eeas.europa.eu/delegations/ecuador/european-union-launches-election-observation-mission-ecuador_en), or foreign governments) will not affect the question resolution. If the result of the election is officially annulled, this question will be **annulled** too.
background_info:
In May 2023, President Guillermo Lasso invoked the [*muerte cruzada*](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Muerte_cruzada), a constitutional provision allowing the president to dissolve the National Assembly, to avoid a likely impeachment. This action dissolved both his presidency and the legislature, leading to [early elections in August 2023](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2023_Ecuadorian_general_election). [Daniel Noboa](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Daniel_Noboa) won the presidential election but National Democratic Action, the political alliance formed to support him, tied for third in the number of National Assembly seats.

In 2024, Ecuador faced a severe security crisis marked by escalating violence from organized crime groups, such as the [Los Choneros cartel](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Los_Choneros). In January, [the cartel's leader](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Jos%C3%A9_Adolfo_Mac%C3%ADas_Villamar), nicknamed Fito, escaped from prison. This, combined with threats of "war" from various organized crime groups, prompted Noboa to declare a [state of emergency](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Jos%C3%A9_Adolfo_Mac%C3%ADas_Villamar) for 60 days. This was extended to 90 days and followed by [multiple](https://www.reuters.com/world/americas/ecuadors-noboa-declares-new-security-state-emergency-2024-05-22/) [other](https://www.gov.uk/government/news/state-of-emergency-declared-in-ecuador) similar declarations, with the latest one being extended [to January 2025](https://www.gov.uk/foreign-travel-advice/ecuador). Noboa's government has faced additional challenges, as Vice President [Verónica Abad](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ver%C3%B3nica_Abad_Rojas) [was suspended for 150 days](https://apnews.com/article/ecuador-daniel-noboa-elections-abad-israel-turkey-8016799ca759405486a4889e12359b46) by the Ministry of Labor, accused of abandoning her duties by failing to comply with a foreign ministry order to relocate from Israel to Turkey. Such a suspension would prevent her from assuming the duties of the president while Noboa campaigned for reelection. A judge later deemed the suspension unconstitutional and reinstated her, but tensions persisted as the government impeded her return to office.

question_text: What will be the average duration of the 97th Academy Awards winning movies in the following seven categories?
resolution_criteria:
This question will resolve as the average movie duration in minutes for the movie corresponding with the 97th Academy Awards winners in the following categories:

* Best Picture
* Best Director
* Best Original Screenplay
* Best Adapted Screenplay
* Best Animated Feature
* Best International Feature Film
* Best Cinematography
fine_print:
* Duration data will be taken from [IMDb](https://www.imdb.com/).
* If a movie wins in multiple categories, it will be counted only once in the average.
background_info:
A [very](https://www.thedartmouth.com/article/2023/10/trends-movies-are-longer) [common](https://www.vanityfair.com/hollywood/2023/07/why-are-movies-sooooo-long-an-investigation) [sentiment](https://variety.com/2022/film/features/batman-spider-man-long-movie-runtimes-1235187797/) [nowadays](https://www.vox.com/culture/24156463/movies-albums-long-songs-scenes-short) is that movies in recent years have been getting longer. A look [at data](https://www.economist.com/culture/2023/10/14/why-films-have-become-so-ridiculously-long) shows that this is not entirely supported, with the average movie length having been about one hour and forty minutes since 1980. Despite that, there seems to be a slight trend since 2020, with the average movie length in 2022 being one hour and forty seven minutes. However, the average movie length of the most popular movies has indeed increased since the 2010s, hitting an all-time high at two and a half hours. One explanation that has been proposed for this is [the rise of streaming platforms](https://www.vox.com/culture/24156463/movies-albums-long-songs-scenes-short):

> Big-time directors now always have the option to jump ship to Netflix and its fellows, where they are promised more creative freedom than ever before. As [Vanity Fair reported last year](https://www.vanityfair.com/hollywood/2023/07/why-are-movies-sooooo-long-an-investigation), the time-slashing producers of old are less powerful, and the name-brand directors who can deliver hits for streamers are more so. That means they no longer have to kill their darlings if they don’t want to. More and more often, they don’t.

question_text: Will the US government announce the renaming of the Gulf of Mexico before April 1, 2025?
resolution_criteria: This question resolves as **Yes** if, before April 1, 2025, the United States federal government officially announces the plan or action of changing the name of the Gulf of Mexico. This can come through an official action of the Executive Branch (e.g., a presidential order, an administration action by the Department of the Interior, an announcement by the United States Board on Geographic Names, etc.) or an act of Congress. Question resolves according to [credible sources](https://www.metaculus.com/faq/#definitions).
background_info:
In a press conference on January 7, 2025, President-Elect Donald Trump [said](https://rollcall.com/factbase/trump/transcript/donald-trump-press-conference-mar-a-lago-january-7-2025/): 

> We're going to be changing the name of the Gulf of Mexico to the Gulf of America, which has a beautiful ring. That covers a lot of territory. The Gulf of America, what a beautiful name and it's appropriate. It's appropriate. And Mexico has to stop allowing millions of people to pour into our country. They can stop them.

In 2015, the US government under President Barack Obama [renamed](https://www.usatoday.com/story/news/politics/2015/08/30/obama-rename-nations-tallest-mountain/71426656/) Mount McKinley to Mount Denali through an order signed by the the Interior Secretary. The Department of the Interior oversees the [United States Board on Geographic Names](https://www.usgs.gov/us-board-on-geographic-names), which maintains the [Geographic Names Information System](https://edits.nationalmap.gov/apps/gaz-domestic/public/search/names), a database of place names.

Additionally, certain members of Congress [have promised](https://www.axios.com/2025/01/07/mtg-trump-gulf-of-mexico-america-bill) to try to make the name change a reality through congressional action, with Representative Marjorie Taylor Greene of Georgia [tweeting](https://x.com/RepMTG/status/1877471320348262563): 

> Today, I officially introduced my bill to rename the Gulf of Mexico the Gulf of America.
>  
> Mexican cartels currently use the Gulf of Mexico to traffic humans, drugs, weapons, and God knows what else while the Mexican government allows them to do it.
>  
> The American people are footing the bill to protect and secure the maritime waterways for commerce to be conducted. Our U.S. armed forces protect the area from any military threats from foreign countries.
>  
> It’s our gulf. The rightful name is the Gulf of America and it’s what the entire world should refer to it as.
>  
> Immediately following President Trump’s announcement, I directed my staff to get the bill drafted. I submitted the bill this afternoon with 14 original cosponsors.
>  
> My bill directs the Chairman of the Board on Geographic Names under the Secretary of the Interior to rename all federal documents and maps within 180 days of being signed into law.

Notably, passing a bill in Congress [would require](https://www.senate.gov/about/powers-procedures/filibusters-cloture.htm) 60 votes in the US Senate.

question_text: Will Intuitive Machines land with fully working payloads on the Moon before April 1, 2025?
resolution_criteria: This question will resolve as **Yes** if, before April 1, 2025, an Intuitive Machines lander has perfectly landed and the payload is delivered in a fully working state on the Moon. Otherwise it will resolve as **No**.
fine_print:
For the purpose of this question, a perfect landing will be defined as one which results in the lander remaining largely intact, able to communicate with the Earth, and which does not prevent its payload from being able to carry out its intended mission.

Every one of the payloads must be able to work as intended for at least 24 hours following the landing. A payload that does not fulfill this will not resolve this question as **No** if 1) Intuitive Machines does not take responsibility for the failure and 2) any other party takes responsibility.
background_info:
After two slow decades at the beginning of the 21st century, the rate of missions to the Moon [has significantly accelerated](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Moon_landing#21st_century_uncrewed_soft_landings_and_attempts). Two missions have already landed on the Moon in 2024 and many more are planned.

One of them was Intuitive Machines' Nova-C lander, which was the first made by a commercial company to land on the Moon, during the IM-1 mission. An obstacle was however encountered and the satellite stumbled on its side. Two missions are planned for this year with the same lander class that plans to deliver NASA payloads.

IM-2 was planned [for January](https://spacenews.com/ice-hunting-lunar-trailblazer-im2-nearly-ready-january-2025-launch/) but has likely been delayed to [February](https://www.rocketlaunch.live/launch/im-2). Among the payloads of IM-2 are a [mass spectrometer, a rover and a drill](https://www.astronomy.com/space-exploration/the-im-2-moon-mission-will-carry-a-blend-of-science-and-art/) that will search the lunar South Pole for water ice.

question_text: How many commercial passenger flights will depart from Damascus International Airport in February, 2025?
resolution_criteria: This question will resolve as the number of departures from the Damascus International Airport (IATA: DAM, ICAO: OSDI) for the dates February 1, 2025 to February 28, 2025, inclusive, according to [flightradar24](https://www.flightradar24.com/data/airports/dam/statistics).
fine_print:
* This question will resolve as the sum of the *tracked* flight numbers for every day of February 2025.
* If flightradar24 appears to show inaccurate data, Metaculus might use alternative credible sources to resolve this question.
background_info: In December 2024, Bashar al-Assad's regime [collapsed](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Fall_of_the_Assad_regime) after a swift opposition offensive, leaving Hay’at Tahrir al-Sham and a coalition of opposition forces in control of key cities, including Damascus. Following that, on January 7, 2025, Damascus International Airport received its first commercial international flight [since the fall of the al-Assad regime](https://www.dw.com/en/syria-first-international-flights-land-after-assad-fall/a-71235844 "since the fall of the Assad regime"). International commercial air traffic in and out of Syria has been greatly diminished diminished since the start of the [Syrian Civil War](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Syrian_civil_war) in 2011, with many nations explicitly [banning flights](https://safeairspace.net/syria/#:~:text=Current%20warnings%20list%20%3A) and restricting flights over Syrian airspace.

question_text: Will there be any active, large, non-contained fires in California on February 15, 2025?
resolution_criteria:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if on February 15, at 20:00 UTC, the [incidents page](https://www.fire.ca.gov/incidents) of the California Department of Forestry and Fire Protection's website shows at least one fire under "Currently Active Incidents" with both

* at least 1,000 acres
* less than 80% containment.
fine_print: If the website appears to not be up-to-date, Metaculus might resolve this question using alternative credible sources.
background_info: California's wildfire season [traditionally peaks](https://www.nytimes.com/2025/01/08/weather/southern-california-fire-winds-dry.html) from late summer through early winter. However, in early January 2025, Southern California [is grappling](https://www.thetimes.co.uk/article/california-los-angeles-fire-pacific-palidades-la-evacuation-latest-news-wctv8656d) with several significant wildfires which have consumed over 25,000 acres around Los Angeles and resulted in at least five fatalities. These fires are exacerbated by powerful Santa Ana winds, with gusts reaching up to 100 mph, and [exceptionally dry conditions](https://www.theatlantic.com/science/archive/2025/01/los-angeles-fires-drought/681243/) due to the lack of substantial rainfall in the preceding months. As of January 9, 2025, another round of Santa Ana winds [is expected](https://abcnews.go.com/US/us-weather-winds-wildfire-los-angeles-california-thursday/story?id=117496931) to further worsen conditions, with a critical fire risk being issued for most of the area.

question_text: What will be the estimated number of average viewers of Super Bowl LIX?
resolution_criteria: This question will resolve as the average number of viewers of Super Bowl LIX, estimated by [Nielsen Media Research](https://www.nielsen.com/news-center/).
fine_print:
* If Nielsen publishes an estimate of the form "more than N million viewers", Metaculus might consult additional credible sources if they are consistent with Nielsen's estimate or resolve to a random number between N+1 and N+499,999, inclusive.
* If Nielsen publishes no estimates before February 23, 2025, Metaculus might consider estimates from alternative credible sources.
background_info:
The [Super Bowl](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Super_Bowl) is the annual championship game of the NFL, played between each season's AFC and NFC conference champions. It has been played since 1967 and gained its name the next year. Since then, it has become an American media powerhouse, making up 9 out of the 10 of the [most watched television programs in American history](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_most-watched_television_broadcasts#United_States), all since 2011. In 2024, Nielsen [reported](https://www.nielsen.com/news-center/2024/super-bowl-lviii-draws-123-7-million-average-viewers-largest-tv-audience-on-record/) 123.7 million average viewers for Super Bowl LVIII, the largest TV audience on record. 

Super Bowl LIX is scheduled for February 9, 2025.

question_text: How many executive orders will Donald Trump issue in Q1 2025?
resolution_criteria:
This question will resolve as the number of Executive Orders signed by Donald J. Trump in Q1 2025 (i.e., before April 1, 2025), according to [the Federal Register](https://www.federalregister.gov/presidential-documents/executive-orders).

#### Note that this question closes early, on March 1, 2025.
fine_print:
* An Executive Order is any presidential document with an Executive Order number. Orders that do not have such a number will not count for this question.
* If the Federal Register delays in publishing an Executive Order, Metaculus might use alternative credible sources to resolve this question, such as [the Presidential Actions archive](https://trumpwhitehouse.archives.gov/presidential-actions/).
* This question will resolve according to the number of Executive Orders signed by Donald Trump before April 1, 2025, according to the Federal Register as of April 7, 2025. The date of publication is immaterial for this question.
background_info:
According to [Wikipedia](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Executive_order):

> In the United States, an executive order is a directive by the president of the United States that manages operations of the federal government. The legal or constitutional basis for executive orders has multiple sources. Article Two of the United States Constitution gives presidents broad executive and enforcement authority to use their discretion to determine how to enforce the law or to otherwise manage the resources and staff of the executive branch. The ability to make such orders is also based on expressed or implied Acts of Congress that delegate to the president some degree of discretionary power (delegated legislation).

The number of Executive Orders that presidents issue in their first months in office has been rising significantly over the past years.

| President      | Period  | Number of EOs |
| -------------- | ------- | ------------- |
| Bill Clinton   | Q1 1993 | 9             |
| George W. Bush | Q1 2021 | 8             |
| Barack Obama   | Q1 2009 | 18            |
| Donald Trump   | Q1 2017 | 23            |
| Joe Biden      | Q1 2021 | 37            |

Will Trump's second term continue this pattern?

question_text: Will the majority of Russian soldiers in Syria withdraw before January 5, 2025?
resolution_criteria:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if, before January 5, 2025, [credible sources](https://www.metaculus.com/faq/#definitions) report that at least one of the following has occurred:

1. The majority of the Russian soldiers that were stationed in Syria in November, 2024 have withdrawn from the country.
2. There are fewer than 2,000 Russian soldiers stationed in Syria on any date after November 30, 2024.

Otherwise, this question resolves as **No**.
fine_print:
* With respect to #1 above, the reports need not explicitly mention November, as long as they mention that the majority of the forces have withdrawn and they do not suggest that such withdrawal took place earlier than December 2024.
* Metaculus will use its best judgment to evaluate reports from credible sources that indicate a withdrawal has occurred. While statements from individual experts (e.g., a national security expert from academia or a think tank) will be considered, greater weight will be given to reports sourced from larger institutions, agencies, or governments (including statements from individuals speaking on behalf of such types of organizations) when determining resolution.
background_info:
On December 8, 2024, a coalition of Syrian rebels entered Damascus, ultimately ousting President Bashar al-Assad, who fled to Moscow and was granted political asylum by the Russian government. 

Russia has had tens of thousands of troops deployed in Syria over the years, with [several thousand remaining](https://kyivindependent.com/the-russian-weapons-in-the-balance-of-syrias-regime-shift/) after the start of the war in Ukraine:

> The BBC estimated that there were around 7,500 Russian soldiers in Syria as of the beginning of 2024.

> “Russia always had a very limited, surgical presence in Syria, and it is easier to sustain a small presence than a large presence,” Anna Borshchevskaya, a senior fellow at the Washington Institute for Near East Policy. She put the likely upper limit for total Russian fighters in Syria closer to 4,500.

question_text: What will be the value of China's CSI 300 stock index at market close on December 31st, 2024?
resolution_criteria: This question resolves as the closing value of the [CSI 300](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/CSI_300_Index) stock index at market close on December 31, 2024, according to [Yahoo Finance](https://finance.yahoo.com/quote/000300.SS/history/), using the "Close" column.
fine_print: - Metaculus will review the resolution source on the resolution date.  In the event that, at the time of such review, the resolution source does not show a closing value for December 31, 2024 (including, without limitation, due to a holiday or halt in trading affecting the December 31st trading day), this question will resolve to the last closing value available for 2024.
background_info:
The [CSI 300 Index](https://finance.yahoo.com/quote/000300.SS/), which tracks the largest companies listed on the Shanghai and Shenzhen stock exchanges, has experienced a period of [heightened volatility](https://vlab.stern.nyu.edu/volatility/VOL.SHSZ300%3AIND-R.GARCH), following a series of policy announcements by the Chinese government. 

In September, Beijing implemented [aggressive measures](https://www.eiu.com/n/china-launches-financial-bazooka-to-lift-economy/) to stimulate the economy, including interest rate cuts, reductions in mortgage down payment requirements, and directives encouraging banks to increase lending for stock market investments. These actions spurred a [dramatic rally](https://www.nytimes.com/2024/10/07/business/china-stocks-csi-300.html) in the index, which rose nearly 35% over a 10-day period as both domestic and international investors rushed to capitalize on the momentum.

In December, the Chinese government [announced](https://www.nytimes.com/2024/12/09/business/china-monetary-policy.html) additional fiscal measures, described as “more proactive,” alongside moderately looser monetary policies aimed at boosting domestic consumption. These included efforts to stabilize the real estate market, support consumer spending, and encourage further investment in key sectors. The announcements [briefly lifted](https://www.reuters.com/markets/asia/china-politburo-policy-shift-spurs-surge-stocks-bonds-2024-12-09/) the CSI 300, though concerns about the sustainability of growth persisted.

This development is part of broader efforts by Beijing to stabilize its economy amid a period of slowing growth and declining consumer confidence.

question_text: Will Blue Origin launch its New Glenn rocket before January 1, 2025?
resolution_criteria:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if, before January 1, 2025, Blue Origin's New Glenn launch vehicle leaves the launchpad under its own power.

If this does not occur before January 1, 2025, this question will resolve as **No**.
fine_print: * This question refers to an integrated configuration of the launch vehicle, consisting of at least [two stages](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/New_Glenn#Description_and_technical_specifications).
background_info:
Aerospace company [Blue Origin](https://www.blueorigin.com/), founded by [Jeff Bezos](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Jeff_Bezos), is preparing for the [inaugural launch](https://arstechnica.com/space/2024/12/intrigue-swirls-as-blue-origin-races-toward-year-end-deadline-for-new-glenn/) of its highly anticipated [New Glenn](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/New_Glenn) rocket. This heavy-lift orbital launch vehicle, named after astronaut John Glenn, represents a key step in the company’s mission to advance commercial spaceflight and compete with other aerospace giants such as SpaceX. The rocket features a 7-meter-diameter payload fairing, providing significant capacity compared to conventional boosters, and is designed for both government and commercial customers.

The rocket is currently at Launch Complex-36 in Florida, with Blue Origin targeting a first flight by the end of 2024. However, a hot-fire test, a critical step before liftoff, has faced [repeated delays](https://www.bnnbloomberg.ca/business/company-news/2024/08/21/bezos-blue-origin-suffers-fiery-setback-building-new-rocket/), and final regulatory approvals are pending from the Federal Aviation Administration.
